body_html: I can't see any reason why this would happen, and I would suspect it might be caused by ray somehow. What's f.remote()? There's no memcpy we're doing when creating PyTorch tensors from numpy (here's the full source, it's just 30 lines). They share the same data pointer.
body_text: I can't see any reason why this would happen, and I would suspect it might be caused by ray somehow. What's f.remote()? There's no memcpy we're doing when creating PyTorch tensors from numpy (here's the full source, it's just 30 lines). They share the same data pointer.
body: I can't see any reason why this would happen, and I would suspect it might be caused by ray somehow. What's `f.remote()`? There's no memcpy we're doing when creating PyTorch tensors from numpy ([here's the full source](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/utils/tensor_numpy.cpp#L91-L124), it's just 30 lines). They share the same data pointer.
